UI_visible_response: "Under the Dome" is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King, first published in 2009. The story is set in the small town of Chester's Mill, Maine, where an invisible and impenetrable dome suddenly descends, cutting off the town from the rest of the world. The novel explores the societal and psychological effects of this event on the town's residents, as well as the struggle for power and survival within the confined space.The book was adapted into a television series of the same name, which aired from 2013 to 2015. The TV series, while based on the novel, introduced several changes to the storyline and characters.In addition to its entertainment value, "Under the Dome" has been analyzed for its themes of environmentalism, governance, and human behavior under extreme conditions. The title itself, "Under the Dome," can be seen as a metaphor for the Earth's atmosphere and the fragile ecosystem that sustains life, highlighting the importance of environmental stewardship.
